CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 20, 1962, page A15, reads: "A "Case" For Health - On exhibit this month at Carnegie Library in Oakland are four miniature sickroom scenes, designed and constructed by Mrs. Benjamin Lencher to illustrate the Red Cross' free courses in home care of the sick and injured. Here, library artist Sylvia Jones admires one of the display cases.  Themes of the tableaux include "the Bed Bath," "Cry in Night," "steam Inhalation" and "Feeding the Patient."
TitMainTitle: Sylvia Jones standing next to Red Cross display case with miniature scenes illustrating "Bed Bath" and "Feeding the Patient," in Carnegie Library, Oakland, horizontal version
